{"step_by_step_thinking": "Royal jelly is a substance secreted by worker bees to feed the queen bee. It is known to have various biological activities and potential health benefits. One of the important properties of royal jelly is its antimicrobial activity. It contains several antimicrobial proteins and peptides that help protect the queen bee and the hive from infections. These proteins and peptides have been found to exhibit activity against a wide range of bacteria and fungi. Therefore, the answer to the question is A. yes, there are antimicrobial proteins in royal jelly.", "answer_choice": "A"}
